revised_title: Uncommon Thunder and Lightning Accident at Leedes
tldr: This article narrates a severe thunderstorm and lightning accident that occurred in Leedes on April 27, 1700. A lightning bolt struck a cottage, causing damage to the interior and injuring several people. One victim, Thomas Lambert, was found with his skin burnt black and hard like parchment. The author, Ralph Thoresby, shares this account as a rare and remarkable event.
